s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE INNER REAR VIEW MIRROR ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: w/o Screw:

s3.ptxt: Push the cover in the direction indicated by the arrows labeled A and remove it.
While holding down the claw in the direction of the black arrow labeled B, slide the inner rear view mirror assembly in the direction of the white arrow and remove it.

s2.ptxt: w/ Screw:

s3.ptxt: Using a T20 "TORX" socket wrench, remove the screw.
Slide the inner rear view mirror assembly in the direction of the arrow and remove it.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR OPENING TRIM LH

s2.ptxt: Partially remove the front door opening trim weatherstrip LH so that the front pillar garnish LH can be removed (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR OPENING TRIM RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedures described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT PILLAR GARNISH LOWER LH

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the lower front pillar garnish.
Using a screwdriver, detach the 3 claws and 3 guides and remove the lower front pillar garnish.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT PILLAR GARNISH LOWER RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT PILLAR GARNISH LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the 3 clips and remove the front pillar garnish.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT PILLAR GARNISH RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE MAP LIGHT ASSEMBLY (w/ Map Light)

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws.
Detach the claw and 2 guides and remove the map light assembly.
Disconnect the connector.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE VISOR ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the guide.
Remove the 2 screws and visor.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE VISOR ASSEMBLY RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE VISOR HOLDER LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 2 claws and remove the visor holder.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE VISOR HOLDER RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE ASSIST GRIP

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure for all assist grips.

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, detach the 4 claws and open the 2 covers.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws and assist grip.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE ROOF HEADLINING ASSEMBLY

atten4.ptxt: It is not necessary to completely remove the roof headlining. Slightly lower the front section of the roof headlining.

s2.ptxt: Partially remove the roof headlining (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT WIPER ARM HEAD CAP

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the front wiper arm head cap.

item.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.
Use the same procedure for both front wiper arm head caps.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and the front wiper arm and blade assembly LH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and the front wiper arm and blade assembly RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE HOOD TO COWL TOP SEAL

s2.ptxt: Using a clip remover, detach the 9 clips and remove the hood to cowl top seal.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE COWL TOP VENTILATOR LOUVER RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the clip.
Detach the 4 claws and 5 guides, and remove the cowl top ventilator louver RH in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE COWL TOP VENTILATOR LOUVER LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the clip.
Detach the 6 claws and 5 guides, and remove the cowl top ventilator louver LH in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT FENDER TO COWL SIDE SEAL LH

s2.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the seal.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the seal excessively.

s2.ptxt: Remove the seal.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT FENDER TO COWL SIDE SEAL RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedures described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE WINDSHIELD MOULDING OUTSIDE

s2.ptxt: Using a knife, cut off the moulding as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the vehicle body.

s2.ptxt: Remove the remaining moulding.

atten4.ptxt: Make a partial cut in the moulding. Then pull and remove it by hand.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE WINDSHIELD GLASS

s2.ptxt: Apply protective tape to the outer surface of the vehicle body to prevent scratches.
From the interior, insert a piano wire between the vehicle body and glass as shown in the illustration.
Tie objects that can serve as handles (for example, wooden blocks) to both wire ends.

item.ptxt: When separating the glass from the vehicle, be careful not to damage the vehicle's paint or interior/exterior ornaments.
To prevent the instrument panel from being scratched when removing the glass, place a plastic sheet between the piano wire and instrument panel.

s2.ptxt: Place matchmarks over the glass and vehicle body on the locations indicated in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Matchmarks do not need to be placed if not reusing the glass.

s2.ptxt: Cut through the adhesive by pulling the piano wire around the glass.

atten3.ptxt: Leave as much adhesive on the vehicle body as possible when cutting through the adhesive.

s2.ptxt: Disengage the stoppers.
Using suction cups, remove the glass.

s-1.ptxt: CLEAN WINDSHIELD GLASS

s2.ptxt: Using a scraper, remove the damaged stoppers, dams and adhesive sticking to the glass.
Clean the outer edges of the glass with white gasoline.

atten3.title: Do not touch the glass surface after cleaning it.
atten3.ptxt: Even if using a new glass, clean it with white gasoline.

s-1.ptxt: CLEAN VEHICLE BODY

s2.ptxt: Clean and shape the contact surface of the vehicle body.

s3.ptxt: On the contact surface of the vehicle body, use a knife to cut away excess adhesive as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Leave as much adhesive on the vehicle body as possible.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the vehicle body.

s2.ptxt: Clean the contact surface of the vehicle body with cleaner.

atten4.ptxt: Even if all the adhesive has been removed, clean the vehicle body.
